overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains a presence across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research related to social media analysis, disinformation, and computational social science. While LinkedIn boasts the largest follower base, engagement is relatively distributed across platforms. He shares updates on research publications, grant awards, conference presentations, and job/PhD opportunities within his field.

contentThemes.description: Announcements of new research papers and publications in the field of social media analysis and disinformation.
Sharing news about awarded grants and research funding opportunities.
Advertising job openings and research positions (postdoctoral and PhD) within the research team.
Promoting upcoming conference presentations and participation in academic events.
Sharing about new versions and capabilities of research tools related to coordinated behaviour analysis, such as CooRnet.

recommendations: Cross-promote content across platforms to maximize reach and engagement.
Use platform-specific hashtags to increase visibility.
Engage more actively with comments and replies on posts.
Experiment with different content formats (e.g., videos, images, polls) to see what resonates best with each audience.
Consider running targeted campaigns to promote specific research findings or events.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows a good balance between likes and reposts, indicating a receptive audience. Focus on sharing concise research updates and engaging with discussions.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon has a smaller follower base and lower engagement compared to other platforms. Consider sharing more thought-provoking content and participating in relevant communities to increase visibility.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn has the largest follower base and strong engagement, particularly regarding job opportunities and grant announcements. Continue to leverage this platform for professional networking and career-related content.
